comment: I didn't mind the new RIF update, but I definitely minded the switch from the GPL. Kudos for keeping the dream alive.

title: A fresh start to an old favorite
comment: Having been a fan of RIF for months, I was really sad when the developer close-sourced it. Then this was announced, and I was happy again. Yay for free (as in speech) software!   Simplicity is good, but I would love to see some improvements in the future. Fixing the auto-message checking, which has been broken for a long time, would be a start. Good luck to you and this new direction!

title: Rif
comment: The new RIF is awful. Ty for getting this up!

title: Thank you!
comment: Reddit is Fun lost me on their last update. You rock!
Awesome stuff, keeping it open source.

title: Loved RiF
comment: But the new version was a bit slow on my phone.

title: Good old RIF 1.x still lives on
comment: Simple and gets the job done. One of the best app for browsing Reddit.
I'm very interested in this project. However, I am unable to log in. I keep getting "Error logging in. Please try again." Any ideas?

title: Back to basics
comment: After the Reddit is fun switch I tried the new version but simply wasn't happy with some of the changes. This app brings it back to what I like: simple UI and a nice truly dark theme without gray colors. I can only hope this app is updated and additional features added like a search function. 5 stars in its current state.
